title: 1970s Bantam Books Cover Slab Serif
content:
Hello, all. I posted this query in the wrong forum, and am reposting. I have a partial answer.

mbcohen  
8.Jul.2008 12.09am  
Can anyone help me identify the slab-serif typeface used on so many Bantam paperbacks of the 70s? Always with outline and heavy shadow. It resembles a condensed bold Clarendon, but the R is distinctive.

You can kind of see it in a terrible image here, from the 1970 edition of Ross MacDonald’s THE GOODBYE LOOK: [http://www.yesterdaysmuse.com/shop\_image/product/067351.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150314211627/http:/www.yesterdaysmuse.com/shop_image/product/067351.jpg "http://www.yesterdaysmuse.com/shop\_image/product/067351.jpg")

To which SuperUltraFabulous very kindly replied:

SuperUltraFabulous  
8.Jul.2008 1.28am  
Hello there:

Just so you know this topic should be posted in the Font ID forum not in the Design forum.

No problem tho, this is Profil (not a misspelling)

Get the Bitstream version here:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/decorated-035/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150314211627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/decorated-035/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/decorated-035/")

Enjoy!

Mikey :-)

However, while Profil/Decorated 035 is definitely a recognizable paperback titling font from the era, and I can definitely use it, it's not quite the one. It is too much of an oblique.

I would appreciate any further assistance anybody might be able to give.

Malachi
author: mbcohen
